page.title: 02VOLIS FARM,KINGSTON ST.MARY
page.content: We spoke to the farmer's wife and she told us that her husband had lived at Volis Farm since 1911; she moved there in 1950. It has 200 acres of cereal - mainly barley - and 100 acres of grass. They have beef cattle, but no dairy cattle. The soil is a light sandy colour and the land is very hilly. The farmer has one assistant and in the summer his wife helps with the harvest. They do not have holidays because they do not want anyone to look after the farm. The farmer has four tractors; many years ago they used horses. The farmer's wife is happy living there. The only other place she would like to live is Bagborough. She shops in Taunton.
